author: parau
title: Tech Talent – Bring Devs to Cardano
description: The shortage of devs is something that affects the software industry.Even so how do we attract devs to participate in the Cardano ecosystem?

f6_assessments.q0: Your team has the ability to recognize the problem of the challenge and pinpoint it. It's the big deal that comes with it, which is the scale of the impact.. The issue you raise is essential for the development of a Cardano ecosystem. Because developers are an integral part of any ecosystem, including Cardano. It would be great if your solution with the right approach attracts developers from all over the world to the Cardano ecosystem.. I understand that some of the issues of the challenge were not easy to define, but you did and made a reasonable argument that addressed the requirements of the challenge.. You are rightly targeting the problem of technology personnel that is the shortage of technology skills, technology developers around the world. Not only that, you also have a solution to find and develop the talent that the digital economy is in need and encourage developers to learn Cardano technology. This makes sense because it will contribute to solving the current and future Cardano ecosystem. Through the Blockchain-based incentive network, you can do this.. Several risks were mentioned by the team as a result of careful study of the problem and its associated solutions to it.. Obviously, you have outlined some of the risks and have come up with solutions to limit them. The risk arises from the beginning of building a product until the establishment of a system, to prevent people who just want to "hack" without adding value to the system, and then you come up with a solution. I completely agree with the risks that you have raised with the accompanying solutions, it is comprehensive and constructive. I recommend adding some of the other risks that you may face while undertaking the project. Because the more risks you list, the more readers will appreciate you because you understand your project well, understand the specific things that must be done in the proposal..
f6_assessments.q1: I think the team has done serious research to map out a clear and reasonable timeline with specific goals. I appreciate this of you. I am pleased when you break down the milestones by month to clearly show the progress of the work. That proves the auditability of the proposal. However, I have a suggestion that you should attach the work progress to specific months of specific years (month/year). Thus, it will be more convincing to the readers of this proposal. In my personal opinion, this is a very reasonable and feasible funding request. But it depends on other factors to propose funding. The presentation of the allocated budget request is one of the important criteria for evaluating the auditability of the proposal. You guys did a pretty good job of this. Pretty detailed, including asking for an extra $25,000 as a reward. Such a detailed presentation creates good conditions for the reader to have a deeper understanding of the proposal. The amount you ask for each piece of work is reasonable. The only thing I regret is not seeing the clear identities of the team members. You have specifically assigned the work of each person along with their expertise. But I only see Parahuari's public identity. What about the identity of the Leader, Web Designer, Web3 Architect for Smart Contract and DIDs architecture...? I recommend that you fully disclose the identities of all team members to increase the auditability of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: KPIs are always the metric that the proposal reviewer is interested in. They would love to see the easy measurement of KPIs in your proposal. The KPI is a parameter to show whether the proposal is realistic or not. You have mentioned KPIs, but it seems that these indicators are difficult to measure, or if measured, it also takes a long time to survey and collect data. On your team, who can measure this metric? I wish you could come up with other KPIs that are easier to understand and implement?. I look forward to a practical test of your proposal. That is the best way to demonstrate success. Your success is simply measured by the number of new developers that were onboarded to the Cardano ecosystem. This is very understandable and practical. Because it is the result of the proposed implementation. A proposal made in good practice will attract new developers. Your proposal is similar to many other proposals that have never been funded by Catalyst. I think that's completely normal. I understand this is your new proposal. But its feasibility can also be seen through the specific presentation in the proposal. The lack of funding makes it new to everyone, but that doesn't make it less viable and doesn't affect the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
I really like the idea of ​​this proposal, it reminds me of job search websites or headhunting companies that are active today. This proposal could be the broader future trend of the so-called job search segment as the subject of the Tech Talent proposal.
This proposal not only solves the problem of finding Tech Talent, but according to the proposal, it is like an organization that trains Tech Talents.
The very idea of ​​the proposal is that everyone participating is rewarded like organizations, mentors, certificaters, talent and this is a problem that can be solved using blockchain. Each position in this proposal must work hard to receive badge rewards
In my opinion, if this idea is accepted and successfully developed on blockchain, I think the problem of finding and developing technology talent will be solved and save costs for both sides.
I agree
f6_assessments.q1:
As someone who has no experience in the field of education, I do not give my opinion whether to agree or disagree because future targeted education is aimed at non-profit. In my opinion, the budget funds the project. This will also be huge.
The project is led by Parahuari (Linkedin), who has more than 20 years of experience in the field of education, I think there is a possibility of success if the right staff are recruited and supported by the community.
Regarding the feasibility of this project, as stated at the beginning of the article because I am inexperienced in the field of education, I am neutral - I neither agree nor disagree.
f6_assessments.q2:
The project sets out very humane educational goals, especially gender equality, which is still a problem in poor countries or remote areas, improving the quality of education at an affordable price. .
But the new proposal only mentions the set target and vision to 2030, but does not give a specific project development roadmap for each phase if the project is approved and disbursed.
The team also did not provide detailed information on how to recruit project development personnel, where the project will be piloted.
So I don't see the transparency of this project. I disagree

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is relevant to this challenge and addresses the following directions proposed : 
-Knowledge base & Documentation
-Samples, recipes and templates
-Support structures
-Incentivization structures

In particular, the approach taken,deriving from network effects, economics of incentivization and gamification promises to be very effective in driving adoption and recruiting tech talent . Credentials would need to be applicable to industry and meet criteria that confirms that developers have skillsets to perform and deliver on their technical expertise.
f6_assessments.q1:
The feasibility explanation provided iin terms of work breaktown structure would benefit from a timeline as well to indicate prospective dates for reaching them.

This would help assign resources ( team and budget ) adequately to meet specific timelines. 

Given that this is a new project as well and first submission to Catalyst, investing in a marketing / communications plan may help and would potentially require a budget as well.
f6_assessments.q2:
A further assessment of KPIs for the business plan would benefit from : 
- identifying which certifications would be relevant for the developer audiences targeted and which organisations will be providing them
- a detailed incentivization plan, which may include incentives as a developer proceeds along a learning path. Measuring the progress of developers along this learning path can help identify reasons for drop-outs , and better organise learning plans
- identifying companies in specific industries who would benefit from tech talent and building a "sales" strategy to facilitate recruitment by those companies.

f6_assessments.q0:
This project reflects a major shortage of human resources that affects the development of the software industry today. To find and make good use of this human resource, is indeed a big challenge.

The proponent has come up with a very cool solution that is to Create a Tech Talent system based on a blockchain platform to help solve the shortage of technology skills around the world. This proposal is in line with the challenge posed... The solutions given are reasonable, solving the problem of the challenge.
The Tech Talent system develops both to find talent in the software industry and to contribute to the development of the Cardano ecosystem. . .

For the project to be successful, the Teach Talent system needs to overcome existing risks and challenges. Building a product in itself is a challenge for all programmers. However, with 20 years of experience as a developer, bringing technology solutions to learning has played many important roles as teacher, programmer, author, tutorial designer, administrator. product managers and researchers... I think that the solutions offered for your journey to conquer the challenge are reasonable. The initial difficulty is to successfully pass this pilot phase, opening an opportunity for software industry growth, while contributing to the development of the successful Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The idea of ​​the plan is very good, with clear milestones and specific goals.

The budget gives detailed, clear, all reasonable explanations.
The budget is divided into 5 parts, from M0 to M6 divided into specific stages and clearly explained. The total cost was 66K$, which was less than 10% of the challenge budget. However, at stage 5, the proponent can apply for an additional 25K ADA as a reward. I think it is also a worthy reward for the Talents that have been found, they have participated in the Cardano community development ecosystem. It is also a well-deserved reward for them. . .

Team members have professional experience, titles, and reasonable assignment of tasks. This team is led by Parahuari - He is an experienced professional, has more than 20 years of experience developing technology solutions for learning, and holds many key roles, information is easily visible on LinkedIn.
f6_assessments.q2:
The budget analysis makes it possible to see the progress, roadmap and measurement indicators, detailed presentation, and specific purposes.

The success of the project can be measured by the number of new developers that have joined the Cardano ecosystem.

It's a brand new project. This proposal is a good idea, useful for the community, with great solutions to find and attract talent to serve the development of the Technology Software community in particular and the Cardano community in general. I believe your efforts are worth it to achieve project success!.

f6_assessments.q0: From realizing the lack of developers that hugely impacts the development of the software industry, this proposal suggested a solution to deal with that. This project is like an incentivization structure that rewards participants to learn the Cardano technology. It demonstrated both its short-term goal, mid-term goal, and long-term goal from encouraging developers to join the Cardano to helping fulfill the technology job needed for the development of Cardano-based projects and further exploit the power of blockchain and community to solve the shortage of tech skills in the world. Therefore, this project will have a huge influence on the Cardano ecosystem not only in the near future but also in the long run. This solution was explained in great detail including two stages with specific KPIs. Besides, it listed its features clearly and compared with the case of GimbaLabs and Catalyst School to emphasize and differentiate it from other projects. This project specifically looks for talent, provides incentives and guidance to new developers, or even cooperates with other projects to help develop the Cardano system. The roles of all related stakeholders involved in this project were also clearly mentioned to better clarify how the project will operate. Another good point here is that some challenges and the way to solve all arising issues when delivering this project were listed.
f6_assessments.q1: As the proposal mentioned earlier, this project will experience two phases and why they will have to do so. Therefore, it could be improved by providing the plan separated into two phases and giving detail of what needs to be done in each stage, adding how long each stage would last. Then, everything would be more synchronized and easy to follow from the beginning to this part. Also, the proposer wants to seek advice from the Catalyst community on whether to proceed with the full proposal with two phases or split it into two projects. So, if the detailed plan was given clearly for two phases, then it would be easier for the catalyst community to evaluate the feasibility of executing two phases in one project or divide into two. Similar to the plan, the budget breakdown should separately mention the cost for each phase. Now, it is good to see that the budget was given for each task in months. However, it could be better to indicate how these budgets were calculated, whether they are done by times, hours, months,...It is highly evaluated that this proposal listed the additional fund apart from the requested one. Regarding the human resources mentioned, It did a great job in outlining the details of a number of team members, their roles, and how long they will work for this project. It also provided background information of the leader with 20+ years of developing tech solutions, which is a strong point to persuade its feasibility. It would be more persuasive if the information of other staff was mentioned as well to show how suitable and important they are to operate this project successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: It is unclear to measure the progress based on the budget breakdown. Instead, it should take advantage of the given KPIs at the beginning as an indicator to track, trace and audit the development of this project. To do so, they need to add some time milestones in the KPIs mentioned as well to let people know from time to time, what should be achieved and which phase the project is in. At first, the proposal mentioned its short-term, middle-term, and long-term goals. So it could base on that to define its success in the short, middle, and long stages. Now it just mentioned the success could be measured by the number of new developers. But, how many new members take part in, then it could be concluded that the project was successfully launched. Therefore, figures should be mentioned here to make the description of the success clear to see.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of this proposal is quite good and aligned with challenge. The project carries a good intention of having a platform to connect talents, use it to enrich Cardano ecosystem and satisfy existing demands. This idea would definitely benefits who are joining the community, the project team and Cardano. The team has had in their mind a whole picture in short term and long term. It’s also really impressive and that they have a vision to keep developing the project and not to lose its initial “momentum”. That show a huge commitment that they’re willing to have with this idea. With the experience in different roles in tech industry, the team has shown that they achieve a certain set of skills and standard to run this project. I agree with the foreseeable problem that the team pointed out. To run a talents program, it’s necessary to  build a rewards system that can motivate a major amount of members. And with the open source platform, the security always needs to be highly considered to bring a fair chance to the community. I’m glad that the team did not miss these fundamental problems.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has a very clear step by step of what needs to be done with clear key metrics. With a well experienced leader who has lots of relevant experiences and knowledges, the implementation plan is straightforward and all steps the team intends to take are well understood. Alongside with that, the budget breakdown is built as following closely to every steps. As a result, it’s possible to make an accurate assessment of the justification of the amount requested. However, I hope that the team can work more on time estimating and give a more detailed required time for each step and each phase, so that the plan can be followed up better.
f6_assessments.q2: With a clear road map, the proposer has provided sufficient information to audit the progress and success of the proposal in short term and also long term. The key performance indicators are all concrete enough so that the community can observe the progress of the proposal, for instance the number of new developers that were onboarded to the Cardano ecosystem and all the other aspects around that.

f6_assessments.q0:
The team proposes a blockchain-based system to help address the worldwide shortage of tech skills. The system will stimulate creativity and development talent by providing digital technology. The project also explains the overview of the product. The goal is set to supply the most in-demand tech skills. Overall, I see the project totally suitable for the short-term, mid-term, and long-term goals. The project also identifies the potential audiences and the way to bring these potential audiences into the development of the Cardano ecosystem. Besides, the project shows clearly the functions and the phases of development. Even, proposers explain more about the two phases of the project to increase persuasion.
The proposal team identifies the result when the project is completed in detail. The result is in sync with the KPIs and promises positive effects for the Cardano ecosystem.
The proposers also have a vision of the challenges that the project brings. At the same time, the team has a plan to deal with these foreseen problems in specific. It means the team had a very thorough project development plan to maximum decrease risks in the process of performing.
f6_assessments.q1:
The strength of the proposal is that proposers present concepts and demonstrate concepts clearly and in detail. However, the project has not yet shown a specific roadmap with each milestone. It should be an actually expected timeline for project completion. The plan should describe in more detail the work items and the plan to implement those items.
The project has a budget plan that is divided reasonably. However, it would be better if proposers divide this budget in specific. For example, the amount of money spent on employees monthly or hourly, or spent on each item.
The proposers have not provided information on the team members required to complete the project. The proposal will be more persuasive if it has a developing team will background knowledge and strong experience in this field. The reader can easier to see the potential of the project through the information from managers.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposers should have to show clear quantitative indicators to track the project's progress. For example, the number of users, the completion time - what activities, the number of traffic... The readers will measure the progress and the development of the project easier. The community can follow up on the progress of the project developing closely.
It seems that we need more detail on describing the criteria that define the project's success. It could be a part of the product or project when it is completed. In this part, the team provides information in general and merger. It does not attract investment if the proposal just mentions that the success of the project can be measured by the number of new developers without a specific number.

f6_assessments.q0: I think the proposal overall meets the challenge and I personally love the challenge. This challenge contributes to Cardano's aim of accelerating the development and evolution of the developer and app ecosystem. With such a clear purpose and consultative government and DOES give value to the Carnado ecosystem that aligns with the issue description, the proposal is well-written and designed. Moreover I think it is a plus point when the proposer gives a figure for deeper understanding. Besides, I can see real numbers, rather than words when referring to the number of proposals under the KPI and Metrics section although it might be hard to do so. That's very commendable.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal outlines exactly what has to be done at each milestone, as well as the timeframes and deliverables for each step. The deliverables are all appropriate for the solution's development. I believe that the project proof of concept can succeed as indicated, given the amount of ADA needed and the early milestones mentioned in the road map. I think you should emphasize that this is a multiphase project, and that additional ideas will be required to fully realize the challenge setting objectives. However, the details of the expenses preparing for growth they will use the budget to spend on it is missing. The team members required to complete the project are missing two.
f6_assessments.q2: Finally, it was not able to identify the data required to evaluate auditability. The following are some suggestions for future Catalyst cycles that the author should consider: Make a road map outlining the actions that must be completed for this plan to be effective. At least every three months, a timetable should be presented. Furthermore, it is critical to set certain success criteria that are preferably linked to dates, such as XX conferences will be scheduled within XX months; XX new members will join the community as a result of their involvement in the hub's activities, and so on. This information is critical for the community to understand the project's status and to be able to compare real and planned information.

f6_assessments.q0: I found this suggestion quite interesting and useful. I think the influence of Tech talent in the future will be high. Because the suggestions you made are very specific, specifically classified subjects in the Tech talent system. Besides, the win-win mechanism will help attract more talents as well as easily operate in the long term. Tech talent is not only useful for companies, but especially for people with difficult economic conditions because talented people will have the opportunity to study, and have financial resources to help their families. surname. This is great.
f6_assessments.q1: I think this project will grow and go further in the future. Because the plans and solutions you give are quite suitable. This is a promising sign for the Cardano community in the future. And in today's difficult conditions, this is a method to help reduce recruitment costs, create favorable conditions, as well as the ability to connect and quickly attract talented people to businesses.
f6_assessments.q2: I feel that could be more metric specific. Analyze data, analyze budgets, KPIs that the system has developed and give specific and public figures. Besides, the success of the project in my opinion is not only the number of new developers joining the project but also the number of developers who have joined or returned to join again. Clarify data and publish metrics on badges companies sponsor to find talent.

f6_assessments.q0: The proponent raised the issue as a developer shortage affecting the software industry. Currently, with developed blockchains like Ethereum, the number of developers is very large, so applications develop very strongly on Ethereum. So if Cardano wants to thrive, it must also have a strong developer community. This proposal is clear and has a great impact on the development of the ecosystem. Proponents offer a solution to create a sustainable ecosystem that rewards developers who not only participate but develop the necessary Cardano skills for the ecosystem to thrive. Specifically (companies identify the tech skills they need by sponsoring digital badges on Tech Talent. Mentors, doing sports coaching, finding people and helping them out. learn the skills needed to win badges sponsored by companies. Sponsor companies have access to a list of people who have won badges). The solution is reasonable but it is for companies with funding and for individuals or small groups it will be difficult to get funding.
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap and timeline given by the proponent are reasonably clear. The project will be implemented in 6 months, each month has clear target tasks and the proposed cost is also detailed monthly. With salary costs, it should be calculated in a detailed way for each job, how many people and how much time it takes to perform, then calculate the hourly unit price. The team has 6 people, but the detailed information only states that 1 person is Parahuari, so the complete information of the remaining 5 members should be added with the assignment of specialized tasks.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics provided by the proponent are incomplete and difficult to measure and difficult to test. You can update information on github, hold weekly video meetings and upload information to media sites. The success of the project can be measured by the number of new developers that have joined the Cardano ecosystem. This is a new proposal, the proponent has no previously funded projects

solution: Create a sustainable ecosystem that rewards devs who not only onboard but develop the Cardano skills necessary for the ecosystem to thrive.
experience: I’ve 20+ years of exp. dev. tech solutions for learning. I’ve played roles as teacher, programmer, author, instructional designer, product manager and researcher working on the dev of several types of educ solutions such as portals, textbooks, sims, adaptive sys and games.
